metadata.title: CVE-2022-20566 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In l2cap_chan_put of l2cap_core, there is a possible use after free due toimproper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with noadditional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-165329981References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1055-dell300x - 4.15.0-1055.60
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1121-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1121.129
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1139-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1139.149
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-197.208').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
